messages: 6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:05): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049: An update on the state of my project: http://i.imgur.com/zYTmX.png
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:05): too much nostalgia

6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:19): My last commit's message is dissing google chrome and safari's JIT: https://github.com 6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2alitz/GameBoy-Online/commit/f7861b83b560ba9fa106ba778d66947193d953c3
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:19): is not pleased.
e9596197bcf2219b77d5e26538dbcc62 (03:40): venting in commit messages is a hallowed tradition
e9596197bcf2219b77d5e26538dbcc62 (03:41): code comments too
e9596197bcf2219b77d5e26538dbcc62 (03:41): that stuff is fun to read
e9596197bcf2219b77d5e26538dbcc62 (03:41): though you have the "I share your pain" feeling
e9596197bcf2219b77d5e26538dbcc62 (03:41): cathartic
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:44): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049: I might use the upcoming webcam API for emulation of the gameboy camera. :D
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (03:44): looking forward to THAT
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:47): e9596197bcf2219b77d5e26538dbcc62: I need to add a commit message bitching about https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=633796 as well
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:48): mozAudio can't count audio samples apparently (Insert LOL math joke here).
e9596197bcf2219b77d5e26538dbcc62 (03:49): well, I see you got kinetik and David Humphrey's attention on that
e9596197bcf2219b77d5e26538dbcc62 (03:49): so that's a good sign
e9596197bcf2219b77d5e26538dbcc62 (03:50): those guys know a thing or two about about a thing or two
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:50): I don't think they want to be seen around a fuzzy math bug though. :P
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:50): *THIS* late in the beta stage of Firefox 4.
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:51): I bet that bug is gonna stay in Firefox 4 all the way into its stable.
e9596197bcf2219b77d5e26538dbcc62 (03:51): don't worry, they gonna fix all this in FF5
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:51): What happened to FF4.1?
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:52): uh-oh, firefox is "pulling a chrome" with version numbers. :/
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:53): I remember the good ol' days when version number changes actually meant something big had changed
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:53): now it's just all incremental
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:53): but the version numbers are going up too much still man!
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (03:53): from chrome dev channel to all 120M users is a maximum of 10 weeks.
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:54): They need to just use the floating point part of the version numbering more often
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (03:54): this means engineers stay more engaged.. and releases dont need to be held up for something to land
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:54): and increment by 0.1 rather than 1 each release
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:54): I just think they need to += 01 their version number instead of version++
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (03:55): numbers would just climb slower
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:55): you guys are gonna hit triple digits with versioning sometime
a5d17df58428f1d15bc813872fbb470e (03:55): they should just use major.minor.patch more consistently i think
a5d17df58428f1d15bc813872fbb470e (03:56): the gem convention is, increment major for backwards-incompatible updates, minor for compatible but obvious updates, and patch for internal or minor updates
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:56): you can still release new versions as often as possible
a5d17df58428f1d15bc813872fbb470e (03:56): FF v3.6.42462 would be fine with me :)
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:56): just don't increment with such a big jump
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:56): a5d17df58428f1d15bc813872fbb470e: Now you're just trolling
a5d17df58428f1d15bc813872fbb470e (03:56): hell, even 3.6.2.<git ref>
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (03:57): browsers should follow whatwg's HTML's lead and just go unversioned.
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (03:58): chrome mostly has. externally we dont market with version numbers
a5d17df58428f1d15bc813872fbb470e (03:58): i really like that approach
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:58): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049: Then how will the IT department know if your browser is up to date? </troll>
a5d17df58428f1d15bc813872fbb470e (03:58): combined with the transparent updating, you're just using "chrome"
a5d17df58428f1d15bc813872fbb470e (03:59): but then you guys do still have fine grained versioning, i see 10.0.648.45
a5d17df58428f1d15bc813872fbb470e (03:59): works really well imo.
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:59): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049: IT guys lock down file system permissions so things like auto-update don't work for many programs in a corporate setting
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (04:00): and I think hiding the version number might count as trolling
